text: No sir. I feel your pain
The divs that are added within DND areas are what makes DND work in the page editor and rendered page. So removing them is not really possible without removing drag and drop functionality.
Hey <@UDHT6N5SM>, the solution I found was find the CSS selector accordingly  with your classes, and set the min-height to 0. I seems that empty sections have a min-height set to 28px
Yup, that's what I ended up doing too. Thanks
but in the long-term I'm definitely going to try to prevent the situation altogether
For a dnd_area where the design(as it is in my case) is just a single module per row (i.e. section) it's just rendered html so no column/row divs are needed
I think that’s a cool idea. We have some stuff in the works that could fix that issue in a different way, but happy to keep an eye on this idea and its upvotes
I suppose I could render the page, extract all the section tags with js and then re-append them cleanly outside of their containing divs...
you can use a <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/hubl/tags#flexible-column|flexible column> instead of dnd <@U01RYFRH40J>
that’ll prevent content editors from putting a row module inside of a half-width column
Gotcha. All of the modules currently in use are full content width sections so it's not really a problem for now but good to know. Thanks!!
the flexible column _should*_ provide cleaner markup… but I can’t remember
